value.name: carbonara
value.description: Carbonara is a type of pasta sauce that means "charbroiled pasta" (charbroiled artisan style). It is made with cheese, black pepper, guanciale or pancetta (salted pork), and chicken eggs.
steps: Boil pasta. Reserve 50 ml of the cooking water.
Mix egg yolks and seasonings in a bowl.
In a pan olive oil and grated garlic. After a while add black pepper and bacon.
When bacon is browned. add spaghetti and cooking water and mix well.

value.name: Neapolitan
value.description:
Neapolitan is a Western-style dish consisting of boiled spaghetti stir-fried with onions, green peppers, ham, and other ingredients and seasoned with tomato ketchup. It is a pasta dish that originated in Japan, and differs from the Italian dish spaghetti alla napoletana, which has a similar name.

Although there is a wide range of pasta dishes with names similar to Neapolitan, this paper will focus on the dish that was widely served in Japanese coffee shops and Western-style restaurants after World War II, which was made from soft wheat with firm noodles and colored with ketchup. Similar pasta dishes in the surrounding area will also be described as appropriate.
steps: Cut bell pepper into thin slices. Cut onion into thin slices. Cut sausage into 5 mm pieces.
Put salad oil in a frying pan, add seasonings and fry.
When the ingredients are cooked, season with salt and pepper, add ketchup, and when the ketchup has evaporated, add spaghetti and an appropriate amount of boiled water.
When the flavors are well blended, it is ready to serve.

value.name: Japanese Mushroom pasta
value.description: Japanese Mushroom pasta is a type of Japanese spaghetti. It is a Japanese pasta dish made with a Japanese-style sauce mainly consisting of mushrooms.
steps: Cut eringi mushrooms in half lengthwise and cut into bite-size pieces. Remove the stones from the shiitake mushrooms and cut into pieces.
Put salted butter in a frying pan and when it is melted, add mushrooms.
When they begin to soften, add seasonings.
Drain and add pasta. Toss all the ingredients together to complete the dish.
